alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:15PM EDT until July 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Charleston and Colleton. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large of thunderstorms with torrential rain extending from Beaufort to Bennetts Point. This area of thunderstorms will meander up into coastal portions of Colleton and lower Charleston County through 8 PM. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Edisto Beach, Johns Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Bennetts Point, Edisto Island, Bears Bluff, Yonges Island, Ladys Island, Wadmalaw Island, Burton, Edisto Beach State Park, Coffin Point and Harbor Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
